meanings.definition: A person who climbs up or down a ladder.
meanings.sent1: The brave lader climbed to the top of the ladder.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker is a skilled lader who can climb any ladder with ease.
meanings.sent3: The lader forgot his lunch at the top of the ladder and had to climb back up to get it.
meanings.sent4: She was a determined lader, always reaching new heights in her career.
meanings.sent5: The lader's job requires a lot of courage and balance.

meanings.definition: A device consisting of a series of bars or rungs used for climbing up or down.
meanings.sent1: The old wooden lader in the barn creaked as he climbed up.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters quickly set up the lader against the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the ladder was a giant scratching post and started climbing it.
meanings.sent4: The ladder of success is not easy to climb, but the view from the top is worth it.
meanings.sent5: The metal lader was sturdy and reliable for reaching high places.
